title: Rosti: Bringing Excellent Services for Sustainable Growth of the Automotive Industry - The Korea Herald
summary: Rosti Group, a leading precision injection moulding company, is committed to sustainability throughout its operations. The company has launched an Energy Efficiency Programme in Europe and plans to roll it out in the US and Asia in 2024. Rosti offers innovative, recyclable, and sustainable solutions, including the use of green resins and technologies such as thermal sublimation and in-mould electronics, to meet the needs of customers in various industries, including automotive.
green_innovation: TRUE, Rosti's Energy Efficiency Programme aims to reduce environmental impacts and promote sustainability in the manufacturing process.
business_innovation: TRUE, Rosti's introduction of the M3 printer from Carbon enables faster printing and mass production of end-use parts, improving product development speed and time to market.
green_product: TRUE, Rosti's use of green resins (10% of total utilization in 2022) and successful development of RHCM technology, which reduces CO2 emissions by over 40% compared to traditional coated injection moulded parts, are examples of green products.
green_process: TRUE, Rosti's adoption of lean tools and techniques, focus on eliminating waste, and emphasis on sustainable design and recycling are examples of green processes.
product_or_process: Energy Efficiency Programme, M3 printer, RHCM technology
likely_naics_codes: ['326199 - Other Plastics Products Manufacturing', '336399 - Other Motor Vehicle Parts Manufacturing', '562998 - Packaging and Labeling Services', '811310 - Commercial Printing (except Screen and Digital Printing)']
greenwashing: The article does not provide evidence of greenwashing.

title: 2023 Capital Spending Survey: Assemblers Continue to Invest - Assembly Magazine
summary: The manufacturing sector in the United States is experiencing a surge in construction spending, thanks to the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (IIJA), the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA), and the CHIPS Act. Companies are investing billions of dollars in new facilities and equipment to produce electric vehicles, solar panels, and other products and processes that align with sustainability goals. This investment is creating jobs and boosting the economy.
green_innovation: TRUE - products and processes are designed to reduce negative environmental externalities
business_innovation: TRUE - new or improved product or process that differs from previous
green_product: TRUE - uses environmentally benign materials, sustainable production processes, promotes recycling and low impact during usage
green_process: TRUE - minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability
likely_naics_codes: ['336111 - Automobile Manufacturing', '336322 - Motor Vehicle Body and Trailer Manufacturing', '332611 - Motor Vehicle Gasoline Engine and Engine Parts Manufacturing', '335999 - All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing']

title: What Positions TCL CSOT to Come out on Top? - LEDinside
summary: TCL CSOT is a leading display manufacturer with a strong commitment to sustainability. The company's investments in green technologies and environmental initiatives are helping to reduce its environmental impact and promote a more sustainable future.

title: ‘Our ambition is to make Tamil Nadu the R&D capital of India, if not Asia’: Dr TRB Rajaa - Autocar Professional
summary: The Indian state of Tamil Nadu is investing heavily in electric vehicles (EVs) and aims to become the EV manufacturing and R&D hub of South Asia. The state is offering incentives to EV manufacturers and creating an ecosystem to support the industry, including a 300-acre EV park and a focus on skilling and training. Tamil Nadu is also working on a scrapping policy to encourage consumers to switch to EVs.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes the state of Tamil Nadu's plans to invest in the EV industry, including the creation of an EV park and a focus on skilling and training. This investment will likely lead to the development of new green innovations in the EV sector.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific product or process that meets the criteria to be a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The article mentions that Tamil Nadu is investing in battery manufacturing, which is a key component of EVs. Batteries are a green product because they help to reduce emissions by powering electric vehicles.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific process that meets the criteria to be a green process.

greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not describe a product or process innovation that is an example of greenwashing.
